subject: Nutrition
title: Cultural Influences on Food Choices
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Cultural Influences on Food Choices.

hook.text: In Japan, breakfast means rice and miso soup. In America, it means cereal and toast. Culture dictates diet.

buildup.text: What you consider 'normal' food is almost entirely shaped by the culture you grew up in.

discovery.text: Children develop permanent food preferences by age five, largely based on family and cultural exposure.

twist.text: Immigrants who switch to a Western diet develop Western disease rates within a single generation.

climax.text: Food culture isn't just traditionâ€”it programs your metabolism and health outcomes from childhood.

punchline.text: Your culture chose your diet before you could.

quiz.question: By what age do children develop permanent food preferences?
